reviewText:
Basic Information
Title: Puzzle Box
Genre: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie, Strategy, Early Access
Developer: BplusGames
Publisher: OtakuMaker.com
Release Date: 1 Apr, 2016

General Impression
Puzzle Box looks like a challenging and relaxing game for every fan of puzzle and indie gamers. In this game, you must place squares of different colors throughout the 2D map, which keeps moving as you progress with your square filling. You have 20 levels to complete, 5 of them being available right now, the other 15 will get available in future updates, you also have 2 game modes to complete: Classic and Copycat. Classic is about placing the squares throughout the map very fast, while in Copycat you are being on a static map, placing many squares, which will create a big art. Even in the Classic mode, you will find many small arts. You get the feeling of being a 2D artist. The menu of this game is very well designed. The graphics are well designed and colorful, the atmosphere is a dynamic and challenging one, the sounds are also enjoyable, the gameplay is very fun and relaxing, the engines are well optimized to run even on a very low-performant computer and the controls are also good.

Strong PointsWell designed graphics for a puzzle game
Dynamic and challenging atmosphere
Enjoyable and relaxing sounds
Relaxing, but in the same time, challenging gameplay
Well optimized engines and controls
Beautifully designed main menu
Many enviroments and arts
Many levels and 2 solid game modes
Very colorful and dynamic maps
Weak PointsProbably a little too fast maps, depends from gamer to gamer
Same soundtrack at every map, there should be more and mixed
Right now, it's way too short for its price (this will improve on full release)
General Ratings
Graphics: 7.5/10
Atmosphere: 8/10
Audio: 7.5/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Story: N/A
Engines: 8.5/10

Personal Rating: 7.9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Puzzle Box:

The game is a basic puzzle game that works with mouse , keyboard and or controller. I prefer to use the keyboard and mouse combo.
After playing Puzzle Box for sometime I found myself thinking that any new person to games could pick this up quite easily and could enjoy the time spent.
The sounds and graphics are quite nice and polished.
You dont need a lot of time spare to play it. This is perfect for children where there attention span drops off fast. Just drop into a game and 5mins max your done , I found the average was around 2-4 mins on the lower levels and as you increase so does the difficulty and time spent to finish each level.

Pros:
- Graphics look nice and sharp.
- All ages can play { good for the kids to learn }
- Sounds are suited well to the game.
- Games are quite fast.
- Heaps of levels to complete.
- Difficulty scales quite well.

Cons:
- A little repetitive for the older more experienced gamer.

Overall:
- 7/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Oh boy, I've been excited for this game since it was in Greenlight - and I can say that it delivered!

Puzzle Box is a very creative and entertaining game for all ages - it's just great all around. The gameplay revolves around dropping block in the right places, but it's surprisingly not repetitive; the game is full of surprises and varieties (which I have to admit I was quite surprised by).

My only complains for this game are the menu (which is conceptually super cool but sometimes rather challenging to navigate through, especially due to it's size) and the drop light (the light that helps you drop your blocks more accurately) that is very hard to see - I don't know if this was intended as a part of the gameplay to add difficulty to the game, but on a lot of the stages it blends with the similarly bright background. It makes it rather challenging to drop boxes accurately, especially in moving stages.

But other than that, I'm loving this game. Hopefully there'll be Steam Achievements and Trading Cards in the future though!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWow, what a beautiful game here! I never play before in this kind of puzzles, specifically when you need make a pixel art picture using colored blocks. Yeah, Puzzle Box - really creative game, even main menu looks awesome, becuase actually its a mini game. Soundtrack also pretty good, I like relaxing melody. But as Puzzle Box is an Early Access product, there are some last levels still under development, so need just wait a little bit, when they will be finished. I can recommend this great game for anyone and no matter how old you are :)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\n10/10, would buy for the kids and mum again. FAMILY FUINColorful little game with a happy little paint jar and an explosive smiling cube. The simple challenge makes it a great choice to entertain the whole family, with very pretty music that speeds up humorously when instructed to. Might be a warmup game to get your little ones ready for Early Childhood assessments like the Wechsler Preschool and Primary Scale of Intelligence. Also a good gateway for turning your kids into MLG squeakers. Also just relaxing and cheerful for anyone of any age range, especially after a long day of work. And it makes maxing pixel art a whole lot more fun and easy. Now git gud, son! No really, kid, git gud. It cost your dad money. Family Fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game fulfills my colouring book desires.

Calming BGM and simple art. Game requires little tutorial as it is pretty straightforward as to how the game works.

You will have to press WASD of the selected colour (the correct colour on the palette will blink) to fill the empty blocks to create the image. Sometimes the colors on the palette are of different shades to its better to use this.

OCD people, stay away. Because its pretty hard to get everything correct with 100% perfection.
voteText: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPuzzle box is a fabulous,creative and addictive 2d puzzle game. It has so many pro points: amazingly-done graphics, smoothing background music, multiple game modes to challenge yourself with, difficulty levels so your can play at your own speed, and much much more! Every level is fairly short so you can pick the game up and play whenever you have a few minutes of free time. I especially recommend this game to people who have kids as this game is something they'll love! The game is only 33% finished and based on it's current performance there is no doubt that it will become one of the best puzzle games of 2016.

reviewText:
Great mix of Puzzle, Platformer and simple fun.
Various game modes to enjoy so the game never gets stale.
And on top of that a lot of content for the small price.

If you like PixelArts, Relaxing Games, Puzzle, Platformer, Variety or just simply look for your fix on colorful games, this one is for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I received a key for review purposes.

A well made fun puzzle game  .
The first game is a rolling screen right to left and you have to drop tiles into place.
I haven't got to the other different puzzles yet but there is quite a few according to the pics on the steam store.
I'll update this review once i've tried the other puzzles in the game.
You can change the keyboard config by using the popup box before you enter the game.
The only problem" i've had is  the mouse doen't seem to be locked into the game window.
As you will find
date:
the game requires  quite a bit of mouse movement and i kept being pulled out the game by clicking on my desktop.
You can play fullscreen if it's a problem for you.
I think any issues will be addressed as the dev starts getting some feedback.
It is an early access game so expect the odd issue.
Press the ESC key from in-game for  some info on how to play  or to change the tileset ."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is a really nice and colorful 2d puzzle game which feels good and addictive to play at. Played for a few hours and one of the things i'd liked is the music very relaxing which fit welldone with the game. About the controls have not any issues, played comfortable with keyboard and mouse and I did not need to change his controls key so leave it untouched. Basically you begins the game to filling some empty boxes which after you complete all of them it's created a pixel art graphic pretty cool and genuine so beating the level you gain coins to keep playing the next level and so and so. Eventhough is not finished the game feels solid so i can't imagine when it get completed with more fun even so I would recommend this game to anyone and highly recommended if you have kids which might be more enjoyable and will get a better experience with you and yours. Rated 10/10
